The '''[[2008 NFL season|2008]] [[Miami Dolphins]] season''' was the organization's 39th season in the [[National Football League]] and 43rd overall.<ref>{{cite web | title = Miami Dolphins History | work = NFL-History.com | url = http://www.nfl-history.com/dolphins.php | accessdate = 2 January | accessyear = 2008 }} </ref> During the regular season the Dolphins completed the greatest single-season turnaround in NFL history<ref>http://beatthesportsbook.com/home/?p=10901</ref><ref>http://www.miamiherald.com/sports/columnists/greg_cote/story/822086.html</ref>, going from a 1-15 regular season record in 2007 to an 11-5 record in 2008. Additionally, they won their division, the [[AFC East]], becoming the first team in NFL history to win their division after only having one win the previous season.
The '''[[2008 NFL season|2008]] [[Miami Dolphins]] season''' was the organization's 39th season in the [[National Football League]] and 43rd overall.<ref>{{cite web | title = Miami Dolphins History | work = NFL-History.com | url = http://www.nfl-history.com/dolphins.php | accessdate = 2 January | accessyear = 2008 }} </ref> During the regular season the Dolphins completed the greatest single-season turnaround in NFL history<ref>http://beatthesportsbook.com/home/?p=10901</ref><ref>http://www.miamiherald.com/sports/columnists/greg_cote/story/822086.html</ref>, going from a 1-15 regular season record in 2007 to an 11-5 record in 2008. Additionally, they won their division, the [[AFC East]], becoming the first team in NFL history to win their division after only having one win the previous season.
